fields.summary: Improve contributors-summary macro to support time scopes

fields.description:
Customer reported several error in IE 6.

1. Clicking menu Favourite and watch.  When I click the link, Ajax circle just keeps on running
2. Restricting page. When clicking "choose me", error message regarding session is displayed.
3. Adding labels on page. When trying to add labels. error message is displayed (see atatchment).

Please find the attachment for a clear description.

Cheers,
fields.summary: Multiple javascript error on IE 6

fields.description:
Confluence renders the page incorrectly when creating a page contains bullet. The steps to reproduce (The default editor is RTE):
# Create a page contains the following in the Rich Text Editor:
{noformat}
* {{Level 1 Monotype}}
** Level 2
{noformat}
# Save the page, 
# Click Edit the page (without editing it) 
# Save again.

PS: It works fine in IE 7

Cheers,
fields.summary: Monospace bullets lose newline when edited with Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
I cannot add favorite or wathed pages with IE6. Ajax circle just keeps on running. See details from attachment.

This problem occurs only with IE6. Works fine with IE7 and Firefox.

From customer's report(s) :

I can't restrict page viewing with IE6. If I try to restrict viewing (choose me) I get error message: Session Error

When I try to add page labels I get an error message (see atatchment). Problem occurs only with IE6.
fields.summary: Problem adding favorite pages and watched pages with IE6
RSS feed cannot be read using Internet explorer 6

fields.description:
(Note: This problem was discussed via Chat with Atlassian Support today. Atlassian were going to create a ticket for it but it seems they may not have done that yet. Problem initially related to numerous plugins including the Adaptavist Community Bubbles (CB) plugin. Guy Fraser from Adaptavist also has a comment on this system problem which I will add to this issue.)

Problem:

That is, the repository is not correctly showing that new plugins are available for all relevant plugins it lists. In this case, the new CB 1.1rc1 plugin is listed but there is no upgrade link. And, the only way to upgrade this plugin (and some others too) via the repository is to first uninstall the plugin and then reinstall it (1.1rc1 is then the version that is listed for installation).

Atlassian said that it may have something to do with metadata being upload or not by developers but I think something else might be broken in the PR plugin itself.
fields.summary: Plugin Repository not always identifying if newer plugins are available

fields.description:
I am setting up confluence as our company intranet and we are about 2 weeks from official launch.  I've just started testing with a basic user account with only the 'confluence-user' group permissions.  All spaces have the confluence-user set up to be able to view & comment.

During testing I found that many, but not all of my space home pages display the message:

You cannot view this page due to inherited restrictions.
Page level restrictions have been applied to a parent of the current page. These restrictions limit access to only certain certain user(s) or group(s) and apply to all pages in the hierarchy underneath the parent.

This doesn't make any sense to me as they are Home pages at the top of the space Tree and should not be inheriting permission from anywhere.

It should also be noted that the home pages that can be viewed were all created more recently that the rest.
The
fields.summary: Inherited restrictions on space home pages
need Vector getSpacePermissions(String token, String spaceKey) remote API method

fields.description:
1. Create a new page.
2. Add the note macro, eg {note}Hello, World!{note}
3. Save.

When viewing the HTML source the col element generated by the macros is not closed. 

Expected the col element closed like <col></col>

This will creates issues for eg. a client(eg. xml-rpc) which expects well formed XML.
I going to try a workaround using server side Tidy, but this should not be necessary.
fields.summary: Note Macro Creates Invalid XML
Not Macro

fields.description:
*How to repeat the problem:*

# Create a new page
#- Set page title to *Ääkkönen*
# Save
# Doc Import what ever document (name doesn't matter)
* *Result:* You'll end up to *Page Not Found*-page

That's because Confluence tries to open page *http://confluence/display/TEST/Ääkkönen* but unfortunately you cannot reference to pages named with non-ascii-letters with their names but only with id.

I know this is a problem by design in Confluence, but importer could resolve this checking page's name first and only after that create a _working_ link (could even be a small fix ;).

This is a big problem, because now user thinks that something went wrong; and because doc importing is a new feature and for many people this could be their first time using it, the first impression isn't too good... Everything making users think "I knew it: it doesn't work" is bad for us trying to drive the wiki-revolution in our company :)
fields.summary: Importing documents with Doc Import ends up to 'Page not found' if page has non-ascii characters in its name

fields.description:
With the following wiki markup on a page, the PDF export is well displayed (as in the web site) :
\[aaa\|http://aaa\]
\*\[aaa\|http://aaa\]\*
\[\*aaa\*\|http://aaa\]
\*\[\*aaa\*\|http://aaa\]\*

whereas the Word export displays:
aaa
aaa
\*aaa\*
\*aaa\*
(4 underlined links, of which only the 2nd and 4th are bold).

This bug is only hindering for our Word exports (which we use to print a review), but the "bold" markup is not always added homogeneously the rich editor (or by our users in wiki markup mode). 

Anyway the best course should be to make it appear alike in Word export.

Also I did not find a "component" relating to Word or PDF exports in the JIRA components menu.

Thanks for your help,
Vincent
fields.summary: bad Word export of bold links (OK in PDF export)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14157].
  {panel}

Hi,

The macro 'attachments' which display the list of the attacted files is great but I think it woulb be useful to be able to specify by parameters which data have to be displayed or not...

Example: when I want to see the overall attached files but not the creator (modifier) of the attached file nor the creation date or size. Just the names in fact :)

In this way, the layout in PDF mode could be less packed than now.

Thanks,
Stephane
fields.summary: Beeing able to chose the layout in attachments macro

fields.description: The Wiki Markup Editor correctly formats SQL statements defined using the Code Macro.  However, if the user switches to the Rich Text Editor, the spaces are removed from the SQL statement.
fields.summary: Code Macro - Rich Text Editor removes spaces

fields.description: When we enter Greek characters in our Confluence pages they work fine for some time but later changing to question marks. Is this a known bug? Do we have any workaround or patch available for this?
fields.summary: Problem with special characters
customizeMacroTable JavaScript error when chart macro used with cache + other macro

fields.description: See attachment, showing the bug in "Colour Schemes" under admin.
fields.summary: stylesheet.page.description in Colour Screen help tips

fields.description:
Due to the reliance on a check within the pageManager for duplicate page titles (instead of being enforced by the DB) two users can end up concurrently creating a page with the same title.

Both pages will be created in the database although Confluence will only retrieve one of them (by title). The other can be retrieved directly by id. From the user's perspective it will appear that the page they have created has just gone to be replaced by the version created by the other concurrent user.
fields.summary: It is possible for two users to create a page with the same title in the same space

fields.description:
OsgiPlugin.isEnabled is a synchronized method that gets called very often creating a bottleneck in high load environments. Our bamboo high load performance build shows that threads spend 17% of overall execution time waiting on this method.

It seems we only call this method so often because we didn't properly fix this issue: [https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-199].
fields.summary: Reduce synchronization bottleneck on OsgiPlugin.isEnabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14149].
  {panel}

Confluence's documentation does not make it clear that Wiki Markup is detected by the product's search functions. A customer raised a query about this, so I thought it would be useful to include this information in the product documentation.

AFAIK, Confluence's search functions can search potentially any form of Wiki Markup, with probably a few exceptions like, for example, words beginning with an asterisk ( * ). Pages containing the sought Wiki Markup are presented in the results list. However, the Wiki Markup's textual context is not clearly indicated in this list, because most of this Markup is removed from the search result text.

If anyone has any additional information to add, like other forms of Wiki Markup that cannot be sought, or if there's content requiring correction or clarification in this JIRA issue, please feel free to add comments - the more the better!

Kind regards,
Giles Gaskell.
fields.summary: Clarify Confluence's Wiki Markup search capabilities in the Confluence DOCs
Linking pages using pageids does not add to the incoming links list

fields.description:
Each plugin has a "Disable plugin" or "Enable plugin" link depending on its status:

!plugin_enable_link.png!

These links result in GET requests. So after clicking 'Disable plugin', the URL looks like /wiki/admin/plugins.action?mode=disable&pluginKey=confluence.extra.webdav

Say I later enable the plugin on a different page, and refresh the page with the above URL. The plugin will be silently disabled again.

This is the practical problem resulting from a disregard for the difference between GET and POST.
fields.summary: 'Disable plugin' should be POST, not GET

fields.description:
I attached a .doc file and tried to display it with {viewfile}, but the macro just displays

viewfile: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 9

There is nothing in the Confluence logs.
fields.summary: Office connector viewfile macro results in ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 9

fields.description:
I set up a mail server using a JNDI configured session using the instructions [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setup+a+mail+session+in+standalone+version] and [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail].

If I *submitted a test email*, or *flush the queue*, everything works as expected.  If I restart confluence and don't perform either of these functions then the normal queue processing fails with this exception:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: Name java:comp is not bound in this Context
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:187)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxSMTPMailServer.send(JmxSMTPMailServer.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.send(AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.send(PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.execute(AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue$TaskDecorator.execute(AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractTaskQueue.flush(AbstractTaskQueue.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.flush(AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.quartz.jobs.TaskQueueFlushJob.doExecute(TaskQueueFlushJob.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.quartz.jobs.AbstractJob.executeInternal(AbstractJob.java:87)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.surroundJobExecutionWithLogging(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:64)

	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:203)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
Caused by: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: Name java:comp is not bound in this Context
	at org.apache.naming.NamingContext.lookup(NamingContext.java:770)

fields.summary: Confluence can't send mail through JNDI configured Mail server until a flush

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14144].
  {panel}

I urge you to develop a standalone GUI executable (i.e. Swing) that can configure our servers, so we can handle all Confluence configuration without having to open a single .xml, .properties, or .out file. Things like connection strings, LDAP, license hash, logs, etc.

75% of the problems we've had with Confluence have involved some sort of config file issue, and it's been a complete nightmare to figure out which file does what. To make matters worse, even though we have a lot of Linux servers, people at my company have very little Java and Tomcat expertise (don't ask).

Ideally, between a nice install wizard and this standalone configuration GUI, I would never need to know a thing about Tomcat, Java, XML, etc. and would never need to fire up PuTTY or struggle with vi.

Having a separate GUI-based configuration program would also solve the "bootstrap" issue, where Confluence needs to be working in order to make certain changes to Confluence.

Atlassian could avoid a lot of support costs if you had a tool like this. A lot of the issues we've needed to contact Atlassian support for could have been avoided had we had an easy-to-use Microsoft-like config GUI. (Microsoft SQL Server is a particularly good example.)

If I get some time, maybe I can mock up a UI.

Thanks for listening,
Bill
fields.summary: Standalone GUI for all Confluence configuration files and logs

fields.description:
If you enter the following markup in a comment on Firefox, the list items are renumbered 0, 1, 2 starting at the 10th, 11th, and 12th items. This does not happen in IE7, and does not happen in the page body for Firefox.

{code}
# one
# two
# three
# four
# five
# six
# seven
# eight
# nine
# ten
# eleven
# twelve
{code}

Looks like this in a comment on Firefox:
1. one
2. two
3. three
4. four
5. five
6. six
7. seven
8. eight
9. nine
0. ten
1. eleven
2. twelve
fields.summary: On Firefox, tens place is stripped in long ordered lists in comment

fields.description:
Here are the use cases:
# I'm typing up a document in word and realize that I want to share it as a wiki page. I click a button inside of Word that says "make this a wiki page" It automatically imports the doc as a wiki page
# I'm inside of Word and want to edit a Confluence wiki page. I click "Edit Confluence Page" and it opens the Confluence page of my choice inside of Word for editing. (perhaps already available in WebDAV)
# I'm working inside of PowerPoint or Keynote and want to share presentation. I click a button that says "share in Confluence" and it automatically attaches the file to a Confluence page.
# I'm inside of Excel and want to share a chart or section of the spreadsheet inside a Confluence wiki page. I click a "share spreadsheet" button, choose the section or chart I wish to share, choose the Confluence page, and it automatically embeds into Confluence 

For all these use-cases there would be one Confluence toolbar for Office. These are the most relevant parts of how MS Office 2007 integrates with MS SharePoint. I've attached a document with screenshots of how the relevant integration points work. The complete document is available at http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=E0D05A69-F67B-4D37-961E-2DB3C4065CB9&displaylang=en#filelist
fields.summary: Office Toolbar for Confluence - see use cases

fields.description:
I installed Confluence 2.10 and succeeded to start the server using the startup.bat file.
Then I tried to make Confluence be started by a Windows service. I followed the procedure described on [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Start+Confluence+automatically+on+Windows+as+a+Service] to deploy the service and start it:
1- service install Confluence210: the service seems installed [^installServiceResult.png]
2- net start Confluence 210: the service seems started  [^startServiceResult.png]
So far so good !
But then when I try to access my Confluence pages, I get (after 5 minutes !!) a 404 error: see [^ServiceDoNotStart.png].
The service is said started but the server failed in its initialization!

fields.description:
If you enter wiki markup like this:
{noformat}[^attachment.txt]{noformat}

Confluence will generate a link with a {{version=x}} parameter.  (Where x is the most recent version at the time of the rendering).

It generally works ok but I have recorded this as a bug for 2 reasons:
# If the link is followed and book marked the user will never get the latest version.
# It's inconsistent with how the [PageName] links work (they go to the most recent version)
fields.summary: Creating attachment link in wiki markup generates link with explicit version number

fields.description:
Found on QA-EAC 3.0-m2-r2

Export a page to Word. The html tags are exported along with the content.
fields.summary: Exporting to Word in anti-XSS mode will include html tags

fields.description:
Performance testing showed that up to 30% of threads at a time are blocked inside IntrospectorCacheImpl class inside velocity. This is a big bottleneck. We can improve the synchronization here by using better data structures (ConcurrentHashMap instead of synchronizing on the whole 'get' method). CPU snapshot reports that getPropertyGet takes 33% of overall execution time and Introspector.getMethod wich uses the same cache(ie. is blocked on the same synchronization block) takes 20% (on my machine). 

I have made some quick changes to velocity caching to get rid of synchronization where possible and run the tests.It decreased the average response time around 10-15% on my machine. I expect the improvement to be not so dramatic on the build box because I have database on the same box as confluence so there is very little IO time.
fields.summary: Reduce blocking in Velocity when accessing cache

fields.description:
Requirements:
1. Replace current message (or add if there isn't one) with the text "Your evaluation license for <Product Name> has expired. Here's the information you need to continue using <Product Name>."
2. The "information you need" link needs to go to this recently updated page on WAC:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/expiredevaluation.jsp

See http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1682606792 for background info.
fields.summary: New evaluation expiry message

fields.description: In Rich Text  editing mode if I have 2 lines of header together, I pressed "Enter" after first line to make a blank line. I insert an image into that blank line, after I save the change and come back to edit mode I see the image has the same header level as previous line of header.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor will treat image as header

fields.description:
When editing in an existing page with multiple paragraphs, if a newline of text, say, a new paragraph is inserted in between two existing paragraphs, the RTE will not be able to preserve the edits. The edits are lost when switching to "Wiki Markup" or "Preview" mode. If use saves directly from RTE, the edits are not saved. This is a show-stopper for users with IE6 SP2. The issue seems only occur to 2.10. I have tested on 2.9.x and it seems OK.

Note: This issue is present when user clicked on the blank line between the paragraphs and start typing. If user click on the end of pervious line and hit enter, the text enter subsequently can be saved. It is the blank line in between the paragrahs in RTE cuasing the problem. Also there is no way delete that blank line with backspace. 

Related Issue: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8440
fields.summary: Rich-Text Editor failed to preserve edits in between paragraphs in IE6

fields.description:
I am debugging some custom code we have written here at the European Commission and fell on the class UserThreadLocalFilter. By analyzing the code inside, I am wondering what's the usage of this filter.

To my understanding, unless I am missing something, Seraph or the RPC subsystem will always handle the authentication to Confluence. Never will the application server handle the authentication process. If this is true, then calling String username = ((HttpServletRequest)servletRequest).getRemoteUser(); (from UserThreadLocalFilter) will always make the variable username null because the application server will never be aware of who is the current user.

Can you confirm my statements ?


Thank you
fields.summary: What is UserThreadLocalFilter for ?

fields.description:
I've seen the \{expand} macro being used on some Confluence pages I've come across, but it does not appear to be documented in the DOC space on CAC.

This page should be added within the "Working with Macros" subsection of the "Confluence User Guide" section on this space.
fields.summary: Add a new page on Confluence's "Expand" Macro

fields.description: As put() always returns the old value it's more effective to use putAll() which doesn't return the old value.
fields.summary: Use putAll() instead of put() on the Coherence cache

fields.description: The current implementation of Hibernates UpdateTimestampsCache, which is used by the query cache, doesn't handle concurrent writes (as stated by the inline documentation). We need to implement a cluster aware version of the UpdateTimestampsCache.
fields.summary: Hibernates UpdateTimestampsCache doesn't handle concurrent writes

The screenshot will also need updating in the docs at [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Attachment%20Storage%20Configuration]

fields.description:
From testing [CONF-13775]

To reproduce:

* Add new page in RTE mode
* Press Ctrl+1 and type "Heading"
* Press enter, and type "normal text"
* Switch to wiki markup, then back to RTE
* There is now an unwanted blank line between the heading and the normal text. Any text entered on this line will not be converted to wiki markup.

This does not happen in Firefox
fields.summary: RTE inserts an extra blank line after headings in IE

fields.description: See attachment for breadcrumbs when selecting "User Macros" in administration.
fields.summary: Invalid breadcrumb when creating user macros

fields.description:
From testing [CONF-13911]

To reproduce:
* Add new page in RTE mode
* Click the bullet list button
* Enter text on 1st line, and press enter
* Press Ctrl+1 to apply a list style.

Firebug displays error:
{code}
[Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIDOMNSHTMLDocument.execCommand]" nsresult: "0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE)" location: "JS frame :: http://chang:8080/confluence/s/1513/3/3.0-SNAPSHOT/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin%3Aeditor-resources/tinyMce-src.js :: anonymous :: line 9206" data: no]
[Break on this error] ed.getDoc().execCommand('FormatBlock', false, val);
{code}
fields.summary: Using a heading style in a list gives Javascript error on Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14114].
  {panel}

There is a new option in the Confluence Admin Console, "Trusted Applications". This option allows you to define an application as a trusted application i.e. Confluence trusts the app defined here. So Confluence is the "trusting" app and the defined application is the "trusted" app.

Currently, you can define Crucible as a trusted app, so that the Crucible-Confluence review feature works.

At the moment, the only mention of trusted apps in the documentation is this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+Up+Trusted+Communication+between+JIRA+and+Confluence
The above page concerns the trusted comms between JIRA and Confluence, where JIRA is the trusting app and Confluence is the trusted app. This is the other side of the equation, i.e. different from the new "Trusted Applications" option in Confluence. For the new  "Trusted Applications" option, we need to describe Confluence as the trusting app.

For an example of the type of doc we need, take a look at the JIRA doc here:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/trusted_applications.html
In this doc, JIRA is the trusting application.
fields.summary: Document the "Trusted Applications" option in the Admin Console

fields.description:
When a customer upgrades to a new version of Confluence they need to know which of their plugins are still compatible with the new version. It would be very nice to be able to use your website or maybe even a feature in Confluence to determine if:

A. The currently installed plugins are supported by Confluence version X (in the app).
or
B. If the selected plugins are supported by Confluence version X (on your website).
fields.summary: Tool for identifying which plugins are compatible with a specific version of confluence
Assignment of JSESSIONIDs
Tasklists break table layout

fields.description: When daily e-mail notification is activated and nothing changed in Confluence users receive notwithstanding an empty e-mail. This is not useful and even annoying as users have to open the e-mail to see that nothing changed. It also lowers server performance.
fields.summary: daily e-mail notification sent even if nothing to notify

fields.description: If one were to move a page to another space, the last modification date would be lost and replaced by the current time.
fields.summary: Retain last modification date of a page moved to another space

fields.description:
Under the *Working Example of Usage* header, it states:

bq. In the example, we have restricted the display to 10 results.

In 2.10, the number of results shown is 15.
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro Documentation Needs update
Confluence can create two pages with the same version

fields.description:
The label 'JIRA Issues' that displays across the top of the table of JIRA issues, in the JIRA Issues macro, is incorrectly capitalised.

It currently reads, 'Jira Issues'.

It should read, 'JIRA Issues'.

For an example, see the JIRA Issues list on [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.13.2+Release+Notes]
fields.summary: Incorrect capitalisation of 'JIRA' in JIRA Issues macro
'Page Not Found' for deleted LDAP users profile

fields.description:
A user removed/deleted directly from LDAP is removed from the User browser, but the Can Use permissions are still associated with it, adding to the license count.
The Can-Use permissions should be revoked for this user when removed from LDAP.

To replicate:

1) Delete a user directly from the LDAP server, ensuring the user is a member of a group with "Can Use" permissions
2) Check that the user does not appear in the user browser
3) The license count still includes this deleted user
4) The EXTERNAL_MEMBERS still have the group memberships
fields.summary: Deleting users from LDAP, does not remove their 'Can-Use' permission

fields.description: If a user macro with an "unprocessed macro body" has a body that contains html, then the html will be rendered in wysiwyg editing and lost when converted back to wiki markup. It should not be lost. Suppose you have a User macro with the following fields: Macro name: b Macro has a body: "Use unprocessed macro body" Output: Macro generates HTML markup Template: $body It's something of a bad idea, because it shouldn't really use an unprocessed body, it should use a wiki macro body, but it is possible, and it will work to make whatever is put inside it as bold. If somebody uses this macro as follows: {noformat} {b}text{b} {noformat} The macro will work when using wikimarkup, rendering text in bold and italics. When using the rich text editor, the italics will be included in the body and text will render in italics. (They probably should be escaped). When the conversion back to wiki markup happens, an assumption is made that the user macro has an unrendered body and so all html is stripped from it. The problem seems to be that com.atlassian.renderer.wysiwyg.WysiwygMacroHelper#renderMacroWithoutRenderableBody (in 2.10) doesn't escape html in the body.
fields.summary: User macros with unprocessed body lose html tags in round trip

fields.description:
The auto html encoding should be skipped for the initial html content displayed in the RTE. The same goes for view page source.

This was fixed by the following changeset:
https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/~author=aro/confluence/trunk?cs=72233
fields.summary: anti-XSS mode breaks RTE-by-default editing and view page source

fields.description: If I have a page attachement with a space as part of its name this file is not exported but a link to it is generated in the output html file. I could not find any problems when I deleted the space characters from the file name.
fields.summary: HTML export skips file attachements with space characters (blanks) in their name
Adding "copy to clipboard" functionality into code macro
Renew the screenshot on the mail plugin documentation.

fields.description: This is particularly to reduce blocking in clustered environments
fields.summary: Remove unncessary sychronization on Hibernates UpdateTimestampsCache

fields.description:
While many deadlocks have been fixed by the work in [CONF-13668], some customers are still experiencing deadlock errors on page views in MS SQL Server due to updates on the OS_PROPERTYENTRY table.  These are not yet understood.  They *may* relate to particular macros being used.

{noformat}
2010-04-06 13:51:14,269 ERROR [http-80-13] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Transaction (Process ID 149) was deadlocked on lock resources with another process and has been chosen as the deadlock victim. Rerun the transaction.
 -- url: /display/mySpace/somePage | page: 2264286 | userName: admin | referer: http://confluence/display/mySpace/anotherPage | action: viewpage
2010-04-06 13:51:14,269 ERROR [http-80-13] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- url: /display/mySpace/somePage | page: 2264286 | userName: admin | referer: http://confluence/display/mySpace/anotherPage | action: viewpage
2010-04-06 13:51:14,269 ERROR [http-80-13] [atlassian.xwork.interceptors.TransactionalInvocation] commitOrRollbackTransaction Action /pages/viewpage.action (ViewPageAction28.execute()) is already completed and can not be committed again.
 -- url: /display/mySpace/somePage | userName: admin | referer: http://confluence/display/mySpace/anotherPage
2010-04-06 13:51:14,269 ERROR [http-80-13] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /display/mySpace/somePage | userName: admin | referer: http://confluence/display/mySpace/anotherPage
org.springframework.transaction.IllegalTransactionStateException: Transaction is already completed - do not call commit or rollback more than once per transaction
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.rollback(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:725)
	at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.TransactionalInvocation.commitOrRollbackTransaction(TransactionalInvocation.java:93)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Deadlocks in SQL Server in OS_PROPERTYENTRY table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14095].
  {panel}

The Site Welcome Message (see Administration->General Configuration->Site Configuration
is currently only visible in the Dashboard.

Since it is possible to configure your login to land on a specific page instead, and bypass the Dashboard, many users will not be able to see the Site Welcome message - rendering it unsuitable for informational messages such as "site will be down this evening for a planned upgrade"

The Site Welcome message should at least be visible on the 1st page on which you land after you login regardless of what that page is.  Alternatively, it should be visible in all wiki spaces (probably in the banner somewhere)
fields.summary: Site Welcome Message should be visible in wiki space banners

fields.description:
Confluence Support Request feature could be improved to be of more immediate use for support and internal systems. 

For more information on the issues with this feature and proposed solution see the [INSTDATA|http://labs.atlassian.com/wiki/display/INSTDATA/Home] project.

For this iteration I would like to ask only for two simple improvements:
# add a unique header parameter to the existing message that we could use to uniquely identify these requests in the support mailbox. E.g. X-Confluence-Support-Request-Version=1.0 or something along those lines.
# attach the collected properties to the message in a machine readable form. I.e. properties.store() should even do at this stage. Attaching the properties to the message will avoid them getting mingled with security and copyright warnings, personal signatures and wrapping etc.
fields.summary: Confluence Support Request Improvements

fields.description: Hibernate's implementation of ReadWriteCache makes heavy use of synchronized methods which is not needed for distributed caches like Coherence and only causes unneccessary contention.
fields.summary: Implement Hibernate's ReadWriteCache in a non blocking way

fields.description: CAC stalled shortly after releasing 2.10.1rc3. Thread dump attached.
fields.summary: AspectJ caused CAC crash 2008-12-31

fields.description:
Here's my use case...I'm creating a team page in Confluence and I want to show the profile picture for each person on my team. The only way to go about doing this is to go to the user's profile page, right click on his profile picture, copy the image location, and then embed the profile picture as an image in the page. Not only is this time consuming and inelegant, the image on the page doesn't get updated when the user updates his/her avatar.

We make it easy to link to a person's profile page by typing \[~username]. Perhaps we could embed a profile image with a macro like \!~username!. If we're going to make Confluence 3.0 more people-centric it might be an opportune time to introduce this enhancement.

This seems to be a very common use case as seen in the following EAC pages:
* http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/MAR/Home
* http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PS/Pre-Sales+Team+Home
* http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/INTSYS/Internal+Systems+Home
fields.summary: Macro for embedding user profile picture to a page

fields.description:
I reproduced this in the marketing space on EAC. Here's what you do:

1) Subscribe to a page in the space by selecting "watch" from the Tools dropdown.
2) Go into the space administration > pages > tree view
3) Move the page to be under a different page in the space.
4) Notice the email notification that gets generated...the "Page moved by" is wrong. It's either choosing the person who created the page or the person who last edited the page, NOT the person who actually moved the page.

When moving the page via the Move option in the Tools menu, or on the Edit Page screen, the notification email is correct.

Looking in the database, it appears that the 'last modifier' is not set correctly when moving pages via the page tree under Browse, Pages. This is perhaps the source of the "modified by" user in the notification email.
fields.summary: Notification mail for page-move displays wrong user when moving via Browse, Pages, Tree

fields.description:
Exporting space to PDF produces nullPointerException in the PDF file.

The steps to reproduce:
# Create a page contains the following content:
{noformat}
{toc}
h1. test1


h1. test2


h1. test3
{noformat}
# Export space where the page belongs to PDF.

the result is as attached.
fields.summary: Exporting space to PDF where the page contains toc macro, produces error message

fields.description: In com.atlassian.confluence.cache.tangosol.hibernate.CoherenceHibernateCache.lock(Object) we don't check if the lock could actually be aquired. Instead we should provide a timeout argument to com.tangosol.util.ConcurrentMap.lock(Object, long) and check if the lock could be aquired within the given timeout. If the lock couldn't be aquired we need to throw an exception.
fields.summary: Locking on cache keys needs to check if the lock was actually aquired
MultiTextFieldQuery to override hashCode() and equals(Object)

fields.description:
If I want to create links that look like this:
[ linkName | Linkname ]

I use this wikimarkup:
 \[ [Weekly|~jrogers:Weekly] \|

Note the space between the first two left square braces.

When I save this page, and then open it back up in wiki markup view, Confluence has removed the space between the braces so that it appears like this:

[linkname...
fields.summary: Confluence rewrites square braces incorrectly

fields.description:
For the 3.0 documentation.

Page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recognised+System+Properties

Text:

| confluence.jmx.disabled | 3.0 | false | Confluence | If set to 'true', will disable Confluence's JMX monitoring. This has the same effect as setting the "enabled" property to false in {{WEB-INF/classes/jmxContext.xml}} |
fields.summary: Document confluence.jmx.disabled system property

fields.description:
When writing a Macro, the renderContext, which is actually a PageContext object, passed to the execute() method returns null for getBaseUrl().

Macro needs the base URL to render an absolute URL.

Currently, the workaround is to invoke GeneralUtil.getGlobalSettings().getBaseUrl() instead.
fields.summary: PageContext returns null for getBaseUrl() method

fields.description:
Currently the only way to disable the JMX exporter is to edit jmxContext.xml and change the enabled property on the bean.

Add a new system property to allow disabling of the exporter.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of JMX via a system property

fields.description:
Using the remote API I am able to set the correct parent of a new page, but cannot change the parent id once it is set.

I'm trying to remotely reparent pages using Confluence 2.10 and it no longer seems to work.

When you're creating a new page on a server remotely it DOES set the correct parent page.

But if you try to again remotely call 'storePage' with a new parent ID the server ignores setting it.

I am able to confirm that I'm setting other data on the page like the content, but the new parentID I'm setting (which does exist) is ignored.

This seems to be the same issue as CONF-1091

keywords: reparenting re-parenting XMLRPC XML-RPC
fields.summary: using the remote XML-RPC API setting a new page parent id does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14077].
  {panel}

"Added by Digant Savalia, last edited by Digant Savalia on Dec 24, 2008"

should just say

"Added by Digant Savalia on Dec 24, 2008"

then if someone's edited it again, then the long version should be shown. Currently it's very hard to see if something's been modified recently or it's actually a brand spanking new news item
fields.summary: "Added by" text should not have "last edited by" if it's only ever been added

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.10, RPC plug-ins don't work.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install Confluence 2.10.
2. Install Sharepoint Connector plug-in.
3. Open your Web browser and try to browse to the following. Note that <site URL> is the base URL of your Confluence site.
<site URL>/rpc/soap/isSPLicenseValid?wsdl
<site URL>/rpc/soap/confluenceservice-v1?wsdl

Expected: WSDL documents of those Web services.
Actual: Page not found
fields.summary: Glue SOAP RPC plug-ins don't work on Confluence 2.10

fields.description: It doesn't seem to be being used anywhere in Confluence. However, it is in the Spring context, so it's possible plugins might be using it. Deprecate it and schedule future removal.
fields.summary: Deprecate ThumbnailInfoFactory

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* Go to:  http://qa-cac.atlassian.com/pages/listpages-alphaview.action?key=CONFEXT&startsWith=a
* Confluence reports that "There are no pages starting with 'a'. "
* This is clearly not the case, as can be seen here: http://qa-cac.atlassian.com/pages/listpages-alphaview.action?key=CONFEXT
* There will be TooManyClauses exceptions in the logs.
fields.summary: Alphabetical listing of pages does not work when there are too many pages beginning with a letter

fields.description:
Steps...

- Clicked on "Preferences" in my personal menu (top right, labelled "Stephen Russell")
- Clicked the "Edit Profile" tab
- Clicked "Contact Details"
- Changed the "Company" > "Title" field
- Clicked "Save"

Contents of every field was wiped. Bummer. Tried to enter in all the information again but encountered the same error. Gave up and wept (in that order).
fields.summary: "Save" button in "Edit my Profile" doesn't work

fields.description:
Confluence is supposed to enforce a unique page title per space rule, but the XML-RPC interface rename function doesn't enforce this rule. I haven't confirmed this but a user has reported it in 2.10.

The rename workaround is undocumented but apparently already used by the Doc importer ( http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Navigating+to+the+Doc+Import+Option ). It will split a Word document into multiple Confluence pages based on headings, but if there are two headings that are the same, it'll create two pages with the same name, and they'll be identified with a "pageId" instead of by the name. 

While you can't add a page with a duplicate name via XML-RPC, you can rename an existing page to a duplicate name. To reproduce:

{code}
# create page 1
page1 = {'content': 'some content', 'title': 'test', 'space': 'TEST'}
res1 = xmlrpc.confluence1.storePage(token, page1)

# try to create page 2 with same name, as sub page of page 1
page2 = page1.copy()
page2["parentId"] = res1["id"]
# fails with com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException:
# The page you are trying to create already exists.

# give it a unique name and create
page2["title"] = 'test2'
res2 = xmlrpc.confluence1.storePage(token, page2)

# rename page 2 to same as page1 name
res2["title"] = page1["title"]
res2 = xmlrpc.confluence1.storePage(token, res2)
{code}
fields.summary: Remote API rename feature should not allow duplicate titles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14068].
  {panel}

We need to import several hundred users from a spreadsheet (which we could convert to XML if needbe, or whatever). how can we import these users without having to type in each one?

Actually if there is a way to do this with sql or java or something that would be good to know.

Thanks,
Chris
fields.summary: allow import of users from xml or excel or something

fields.description:
My company is a Jira Enterprise user and we are thinking about getting Confluence Enterprise as our document and all-around collaboration system. The main feature that is needed is versioning of attachments (which works fine) and easy editing of office files without the need of downloading and uploading (like Sharepoint). The problem is that the second feature - just doesn't work. File, let's say a .ppt document, opens in Power Point as read-only. Error message attached.

Also, please take a look at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14062

We will make the decision of getting Confluence Enterprise based on the functionality and features of trial version downloaded from your web site.

Cheers,

Marko
fields.summary: Read-only office connector
Allow incoming trackback pings to protected pages
Using cloaks with the TOC macro

fields.description:
There are well over 25 JavaScript and CSS resources included in Confluence version 2.10 and none seem to be minified. Suggest combining some of these files if possible to reduce the total number of server requests (where possible, this can improve performance). The Yahoo! User Interface Library online provides an extremely good CSS and JavaScript minifier called YUI Compressor. I recommend that you consider using that also. In my opinion, it is not good for a commercial product to ship scripts unminified. A good practice would be to include the master scripts and the -min versions in the source, but let the production release use only the -min versions.

You can find the YUI Compressor here:
http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/compressor/
fields.summary: Reduce number of server requests and minify scripts

fields.description:
Using {viewfile:AdStepJira.doc} generates an error:

viewfile: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 9

Is there any other way to get "open in word" or "edit in word" besides using {viewfile} and clicking the hidden gray bar?

We don't need the functionality of viewing word files inside confluence, it's useless to us, but we do need editing of word attachments from the attachments list without having to download/upload.

It would be better to implement flash reader for .doc files, like the one for .ppt and .pdf. Now we have a semi-functional .doc interpreter that cannot interpret average enterprise .doc file.

Cheers,

Marko
fields.summary: Error when opening .doc files with Office Connector
Blog Post macro apply "Read more" immediately after {exerpt}
Shortcut Keys for Confluence pages created by user

fields.description:
Recent performance testing showed that synchronization inside ognl.EvaluationPool is a performance bottleneck in high load instances.
Threads blocked on ognl.EvaluationPool.create contribute a lot to overall execution time: [http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/2008-12-23+Confluence+Performance+Bottlenecks]

We should get rid of pooling as Evaluation is a lightweight object.
fields.summary: synchronization inside ognl.EvaluationPool is a performance bottleneck in high load instances
Whitespace added between {section} and {column} every wysiwyg round-trip

fields.description:
!http://img.skitch.com/20081223-xjyg2xdknbupheaddtcu4896fg.png!

!http://img.skitch.com/20081229-8qberb493i7n853ge97aaenuy3.png!

From page: [http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1693418548], attempted to restrict page view to myself.
fields.summary: Page restrictions in personal spaces have invalid meta-data

fields.description:
To use subscript or superscript, one will need to type as follow: {{\^Text^}} or {{\~Text~}}.

But if there is no space in front of the ^ or ~ character, for example:
{noformat}
Bah bah^text^
{noformat}

Then the super/sub script won't work.

A customer requested for this to be changed so that these functions do not need to have a space in the front to work.
fields.summary: make superscript and subscript functions ignore character in front of them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14053].
  {panel}

When used in dynamic mode, the non-wrapping columns (such as Assignee or Reporter) do not display the content completely.
Please extend jiraissues macro to expand these columns to correct width.

An example is available here:
http://confluence.demo.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Confluence+2.10+jiraissues+macro+problem
fields.summary: Improve Jiraissues macro to  expand non-wrapping columns to the correct width
Gallery Macro doesn't allow for long text.
Inserting user macro in alias breaks the rendered text
